title: I Made a grave mistake and REALLY NEED the support of ALL RIOT EMPLOYEES that can help.
body:
I really need input from as many Rioters as possible on this matter. Especially the dev team or "lore" makers. I recently name changed to Flocks of Teemo, but it just dawned on me that I may be inaccurately describing the scientific grouping of multiple Teemo.  I would like to ask for solid input from all of you at Riot if it is indeed a flock or iff it is a different collective name. Also I would like to know if the plural of of Teemo is in fact Teemo or if it may be Teemi or Teemos. 

I really need help on this subject and it is of the utmost importance.

replies.body: Let's be real here, it's clearly a *murder of Teemos.*
It really should be Teemoes, like "tomatoes" or "potatoes", IMO
I hope you mean "A *Nuisance* of Teemos."

> Mushrooms that are in a close group but not close enough to be called a cluster are said to be in a troop. Mushrooms in a group that is a bit more scattered and irregular (loose discipline!) are said to be gregarious.

Clearly you are a Gregarious Teemo since you are one of many unorganized Teemo players. If you should form a group and play in a tightly organized fashion, you a Cluster, or if you are less organized, a Troop. If you were the only Teemo player, you would be a Solitary Teemo.
